intro: Erysimum versicolor, commonly known as the variable wallflower, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its variable flower colors, ranging from yellow to red, and its upright, branching stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, four-petaled flowers. Its leaves are alternate, serrated, and often covered in fine hairs. Native to Europe and western Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
